page.title: 15A Bronze Age skeleton
page.content: In March 1985 Halling quarry workers discovered ditches approximately 12 metres apart cut into the chalk near Pilgrims Way. In one ditch they discovered some remains of a body,just feet and ankles were found. The rest of the body had been scraped away during quarrying.The bronze age body had been buried facing the River Medway. Another body was found in a crouching position and covered with large flints. From the state of the teeth the person was rather young(20 or so).It was quite tall.It is rare to find it here.Its age is about 1,000 B.C. In 1912 a skeleton was found in Lower Halling.It was dated about 2,000 B.C.and is in store at the British Museum.
